Name: Laura Mar (Jesus Alberto) Luna
Description: TvT partner organization Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans canalcncarauca.com   03.07.2013

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was found dead in a gully. Although they were described as "a man dressed in women's clothing" it is likely that the victim was a trans woman and tdor.info describes them as such.

> A man dressed in women's clothing was found dead Sunday morning in a gully in northwest Houston, police said.
>
> Houston Police Department homicide detectives received a call about 8:45 a.m. reporting a dead body in Brickhouse Gully, near 4100 Antoine, east of the Northwest Freeway, underneath a bridge.
>
> The man, wearing what appears to be a black dress and panty hose, was found in shallow water appearing to be about 3 inches deep.
>
> Police said two juveniles told someone about the body. The juveniles left and the person called authorities. "At this point, it is not believed the two juveniles were involved in the victim's death, but our investigators do want to speak with them about what they saw," said Houston Police Department spokesman Victor Senties.
>
> An autopsy is scheduled.

Her death was not recorded on the official TDoR 2013 list released by Transgender Europe (TGEU) in November 2013, but was recorded by https://tdor.info.

https://www.chron.com/news/houston-texas/houston/article/Dead-body-found-in-NW-Houston-gully-4651044.php

Name: Dora Özer
Description:
Dora was stabbed to death in her home.

> A 24-year-old trans woman was stabbed to death at her home last evening in the touristic province of Kusadasi in Turkey. Found dead by her housemate, Dora is the most recent victim of transphobic violence in the country.
> 
> Dora’s body was sent for an autopsy and an investigation has been started to find murderer. However, Ministry of Family and Social Policies has not made a declaration yet.
>
> Protests condemning transphobia and hate crimes will be held in Istanbul, Ankara, Izmir and Eskisehir on Friday at 6 pm.
>
> Kaos GL and Pink Life LGBTT Associations in Ankara declared a statement against government’s reluctance to tackle transphobic violence at large and criticized the fact that murderers of trans people are either not found or judged with minimum punishments due to the concept of “unjust provocation” in the Turkish legal system.
> 
> Buse Kiliçkaya, a trans activist from Pink Life LGBTT Association, stated that everyone should develop a sensitivity towards trans murders. Kiliçkaya also pointed at a parallel between Gezi Park protests and trans struggle, saying that “the resistance is no different.”
 
In social media, LGBT activists criticize mainstream media’s insistence on publishing trans people’s identity names, not the ones they actually use.  

TvT project: KAOS GL Magazine, 10.07.2013

http://kaosgl.org/page.php?id=14472

http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/transgendered-woman-stabbed-to-death-in-aegean-province--50400

https://www.facebook.com/transdayofremembrance/photos/a.400503890033355/487450188005391/?type=3&theater

Name: Jock Maurice McKinney ("Valarie")
Description:
Jock was an openly gay man who often crossdressed as Valarie. Newspaper reports quoted friends saying that he was a very caring and warmhearted person and suspect that the murder may have been a hate crime.

> 50-year-old Mckinney was shot to death in the early morning hours of July 12th, near where a makeshift memorial now stands on Kennedy Drive.
>
> He was also an openly gay man, who his friends say often dressed in women's clothing.
>
> Those who knew him wonder if that could lead police to a motive.
> 
> "We have family, he had family. It's just sad. I'd hate to lose my best friend, you know," comments Antonio Barnum, who says McKinney lived in the apartment building next to door to Barnum's.

TvT project: KSL 01.08.2013 & Shreveport Times 16.07.2013 & Lousiana Radio Network 17.07.2013

Name: Natália Sotero
Description:
Natália was shot 3 times at around 2.30am at Rua Bom Jesus do Iguapen in the Boqueirão neighborhood of Curitiba. She died at the scene.

> "She was with some other trans, when someone went there, talked to her, argued, and half an hour later came back with four other guys in a black car. There was a fight and one of the guys gave three or four shots," said.

Name: Diamond Williams
Description:
Diamond was stabbed by Charles Sargent, 43. He then dismembered her and dumped her body parts in a vacant lot in the Strawberry Mansion section of Philadelphia.

Sargent was convicted of her murder in March 2018 and jailed for life.

> Friends and family of Diamond Williams, a transgender woman in the Strawberry Mansion area of Philadelphia, gathered last night at Love Park for a Vigil and Speak Out held in her honor.  
> 
> According to GLAAD, speakers at the event included: Christian Axvaier Lovehall of Philly Trans* March, Samantha Jo Dato of Mazzoni Center’s Trans* Wellness Project, Aamina Morrison, Co-director of Trans-health Information Program (TIP), Sade Ali of Philadelphia Deputy Commissioner Department of Behavioral Health and Intellectual Disability Services, and Gloria Casarez, Director of LGBT Affairs at the Mayor’s Office, among others.
> 
> Rachel Rose remembers Diamond Williams as a person with a big personality and an even bigger heart.
> 
> "She was so full of life. She was funny and we used to laugh. And I remember just acting silly with her and I just miss her because we had a lot of great times," Rose said.
> 
> “She was a very loving, caring, and creative person. We were family. We were like sisters and she loved her sisters. No one should ever have to die the way she died.”
> 
> Following Williams’ murder last week, media coverage of the crime generated an immense backlash among activists and members of the queer community. The repeated misgendering of Williams and perceived victim-blaming by numerous news outlets sent familiar shockwaves through these communities, as well as initiated a formal response by GLAAD.
> 
> In light of these facts, GALAEI Executive Director Elicia Gonzales released this statement surrounding last night’s vigil: “We are sad and outraged — saddened at the loss of yet another transwoman in Philadelphia, and outraged by the insensitive, inaccurate, and transphobic reporting by local police and media. Tonight we unite to honor the life of Diamond and to demand justice and respect for all members of our brave and resilient community.” 

TvT project: Huffington Post 24.07.2013 & Philly Com 25.07.2013 & Philadelphia Gay News 29.07.2013 & NBC Philadelphia 23.07.2013

Description:
Hari was killed by a friend who crushe her head with a stone. The suspect told the police that the victim wanted to have sex with him. Being upset with her advances he took a stone and killed her.

Name: R. da Silva Tavares
Description:
R. was found dead with gunshot wounds on a plot of land. She had last been seen getting into a car with two men inside.

> [deadname] da Silva Tavares, 21, was found dead with six shots on a land in the municipality of Magé, in Baixada Fluminense.
>
> The young [woman] was [transgender] and was last seen at a kiosk in Magé. On the occasion, on 19 July last, she was accompanied by another [trans woman] and entered a white car with two men inside.
>
> The holder of the Magé police station (65 ª DP), Robson da Costa Ferreira da Silva, has heard three witnesses and does not rule out that the crime may have been motivated by revenge or homophobia.
>
> According to relatives of the victim, [deadname] had no enemies and her [gender] was always respected by her family and his friends.

Name: Shanayne Rodrigues Macena
Description:
Shanayne was stabbed multiple times in the face as she was walking home after a night out with friends.

She was a hairdresser who had run as a candidate for councillor the previous year.

> A crime with refinements of cruelty was recorded on Sunday (21), in the city of Nova Floresta, in the Paraiba Agreste. A [trans woman], who was a candidate for councilor in 2012, was murdered with fish knife blows.
>
> According to information from Picuí regional delegate João Joaldo, 29-year-old hairdresser [deadname] 
 Macena, known as “Shanayne”, was drinking with friends in a bar and then left.
>
> “We learned that the victim spent Saturday night (20) drinking with friends in a bar on the Rumbling site in the countryside before she left. On Sunday morning (21), Josinaldo's body was found mutilated on a back road, ”said the delegate.
>
> Delegate Tércio de Sousa commented that her face was disfigured by several [knife[ blows. “The person who committed the crime was very angry with the victim. Her face was mangled. There had been a lot of deep blows.”
>
> The reason for the crime is still unknown. However, police will investigate whether a fight the victim was involved in about a month ago could be related to her death.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & O Paralelo 21.07.2013

Name: Dwayne Jones ("Gully Queen")
Description:
Dwayne was killed after attending a party in female clothing. When people recognized that she was not a cisgender woman, a mob chased and killed her. Her body was found with multiple stab wounds and a gunshot wound.

A newspaper report citing friends of Jones stated that two years before she had been kicked out of the family home by her father and had to leave school because of her gender expression.

> MONTEGO BAY, Jamaica (AP) — Dwayne Jones was relentlessly teased in high school for being effeminate until he dropped out. His father not only kicked him out of the house at the age of 14 but also helped jeering neighbors push the youngster from the rough Jamaican slum where he grew up.
>
> By age 16, the teenager was dead — beaten, stabbed, shot and run over by a car when he showed up at a street party dressed as a woman. His mistake: confiding to a friend that he was attending a "straight" party as a girl for the first time in his life.
>
> "When I saw Dwayne's body, I started shaking and crying," said Khloe, one of three transgendered friends who shared a derelict house with the teenager in the hills above the north coast city of Montego Bay. Like most transgenders and gays in Jamaica, Khloe wouldn't give a full name out of fear.
>
> "It was horrible. It was so, so painful to see him like that."

TvT project: USA Today 11.08.2013 & Human Rights Watch 01.08.2013 & JHFlag 23.07.2013

Name: Mylène
Description:
Myléne was beaten to death with a hammer in her home in Couzeix, northwest of Limoges.

> A transgender woman was murdered with a hammer in [Couzeix], France last week.
>
> While police and local media are describing her as a transvestite or a cross-dresser, she was known by her friends and neighbors as Myléne.
>
> The 42-year-old hairdresser was discovered by firefighters in her home in Couzeix at 8.30pm local time on Thursday evening (25 July).
>
> A spokesperson for the investigation, who used male pronouns while describing her, said: ‘His friends were concerned about not having seen him for 24 hours so they raised the alarm’.
> 
> According to preliminary results, Myléne was murdered on Wednesday night.
>
> ‘It could have been an “appointment” that went wrong’, the spokesperson said, adding it was a theory yet to be confirmed.

On 17th September 2015, Petar Yankov was sentenced to 25 years for her murder.

TvT project: Le populaire, 26.07.2013 & SuedOuest 26.07.2013

Name: Gaye
Description:
Gaye was found dead in her apartment. She was working as a flower seller.

> Gaye, a trans woman working as flower seller, has been found dead in her apartment in downtown Istanbul (Beyoglu). 
>
>The autopsy report will tell us how she was murdered, Ebru Kiranci from Istanbul LGBTT told bianet. “We have assigned a lawyer to this case and we will be on the pursuit.” 
>
> Urging the officials to pass a law against hate crimes immediately, Kiranci said the following: 
> 
> “Gaye opened a flower shop. She had a lover for 15 years and they were living together. We last say each other 3 days ago, and she was murdered that night. Yesterday, they found her dead body.
>
> “This is another hate crime. But who did it? We need a law against hate crimes immediately. Is human life this cheap?” 
>
> “As Istanbul LGBTT, we have assigned a lawyer for this case and we will be on the pursuit. Police didn’t make a statement on how the murder happened. When I went to her apartment last night, Gaye’s neighbors said she might have been strangled but ultimately we will find it after the autopsy.”

TVT project: TGEU SC member Kemal Ordek

Name: Savana Vougue
Description:
Savana was shot in the face while working in the Bela Vista neighborhood on Saturday 27th July and died in hospital the following day.

Reportedly she was shot in error and the intended target was another trans sex worker working at the same location.

> In an interview with the G1, the president of the Piauiense Group of Transsexuals and Transvestites (GPTrans), Maria Laura dos Reis, described how the crime happened. According to her, the shot that Savana took was not aimed at her, but at a colleague called India working at the same point.
> 
> "Savana was on the point with other girls when the suspect known as Tiny arrived. As soon as the car stopped, Savannah approached thinking her was a customer, but he did not say anything and fired. One shot hit her face and the other hit the arm of India, who was behind her," said Maria Laura. 
> 
> The other [trans woman] working on the spot called the police and the Mobile Emergency Care Service (Samu). According to the president, the motivation for the crime was a debt that the suspect had with India.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Cidade Verde 29.07.2013

https://www.facebook.com/transdayofremembrance/photos/a.400503890033355/488914074525669/?type=3&theater

Name: Andrea Oliviero
Description:
Andrea's body was found on platform 10 of Roma Termini station. She had been beaten.

Andrea was of Colombian descent. In a video interview made several days before her murder, she stated that the Termini Station was her home, but that she was afraid and didn't feel safe there.

> Andrea says she left Colombia to try her luck in Italy. However, the impact on her of Rome and the station was devastating. After being robbed several times, the young woman had a paralysed arm and a bad leg. Just that leg and the limp with which she dragged herself made her particularly recognisable to the people of Termini. Her paralyzed arm and injured leg were the result of an assault which ended with the theft of her phone and passport: "In Ostia a boy hit me, I was seven months in a coma". Also for this reason his dream was to "meet a guy with a lot of money that makes me leave the road because it is too ugly".
> 
> Maria Gabriella Lanza, the journalist who collected her story, described Andrea as follows: "While smiling in front of the camera and asking laughing if it was good footage, Andrea did not think about death....she did not expect to die a few days later wearing her pink skirt and her sneakers. She thought of the future - because in spite of everything she had not lost hope. "I would like to meet a guy with a lot of money that will help me leave the road because it's too ugly", she told us. A sad smile, her story, her life, today [at her funeral] there were only two or three homeless people from the station, her traveling companions and nobody else".

TvT project: Il Tempo 30.07.2013 & Corriere della Serra 01.08.2013 & Roma Today 01.08.2013

Name: Dayana (Alejandro) Mónico Hernández
Description: TvT partner organization Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans: eH consulta.com 17.07.2013
